messages.content:
Casenote:
19-year-old male with sickle cell anemia presenting with 3-day history of back pain. No abdominal symptoms. Treated with IV fluids and morphine. Labs show indirect hyperbilirubinemia. Impression: sickle cell crisis.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
93-year-old female with confusion and history of CHF and COPD. Possibly took excess Tylenol PM. Found oriented x1, returned to baseline in ED. No acute findings. Discharged with dementia and CHF instructions.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
17-year-old female with Ecstasy and alcohol use. Initial symptoms of agitation, tremors, and vomiting. On ED arrival: stable, asymptomatic. Diagnosis: acute Ecstasy intoxication.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
20-year-old male with prior amphetamine-induced MIs presents with burning chest pain. Pain resolved with Mylanta/lidocaine. Workup negative. Impression: non-cardiac chest pain, likely esophageal reflux.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
49-year-old male with COPD presents in respiratory failure. Intubated in ED. CT shows no pneumonia. Purulent secretions at intubation. Impression: acute respiratory failure due to COPD exacerbation.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
56-year-old male with acute-onset left-sided weakness, slurred speech. CT negative. Carotid ultrasound shows right ICA occlusion. Impression: stroke in evolution.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
43-year-old male with mesenteric venous thrombosis and ischemic bowel requiring resection. In septic shock, intubated in ICU. Impression: mesenteric ischemia.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
73-year-old female with BRBPR and dizziness. History of GI bleed on anticoagulation. Colonoscopy previously showed diverticulosis and hemorrhoids. Impression: lower GI bleeding, hemorrhoidal source.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
17-year-old male swimmer dropped a weight on his feet. Abrasions and avulsion injuries noted. X-ray negative. Impression: foot contusions.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
16-year-old female with 48-hour headache, right frontal. Exam shows trapezius muscle spasm. Resolved with Norflex, Zofran, morphine. Impression: tension-type headache.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
25-year-old female with foul-smelling, gray vaginal discharge. Positive clue cells on exam. Impression: bacterial vaginosis.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
66-year-old female with dizziness, BP 195/83, HR 121. Daily alcohol use. Improved with metoprolol. Impression: dizziness secondary to uncontrolled hypertension and early alcohol withdrawal.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
42-year-old male fell while running for a taxi. Chin and forehead lacerations. BAC 0.146. Impression: facial trauma due to alcohol intoxication.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
28-year-old G1 at 8-9 weeks presents with intractable vomiting, blood-tinged emesis. Ketonuria, mildly elevated liver enzymes. Impression: hyperemesis gravidarum.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
58-year-old male with dental fracture of tooth #18, jaw pain. No abscess. Impression: acute dental fracture.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
73-year-old female with melena, known PUD. Drop in Hct, received transfusion. Impression: upper GI bleed.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
29-year-old male with bleeding penile mass. Longstanding, torn during intercourse. Impression: penile lesion for urology follow-up.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
26-year-old G2P1 at 28 weeks with LLQ pain, constipation, nausea, and vomiting. Stool felt on rectal exam. Impression: constipation in pregnancy.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
11-year-old male admitted with ear pain and blood drainage. CT initially suggested mastoiditis, later ruled out. Treated as AOM. Impression: acute otitis media.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
61-year-old male with metastatic prostate cancer and nephrostomy tubes presents with minor urine leakage. No infection or acute findings. Impression: attention to nephrostomy site.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
16-year-old female struck her head during flag practice. Brief dizziness and diplopia. CT normal. Impression: minor head injury.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
43-year-old male with large bowel necrosis from mesenteric ischemia. Bowel resected. Septic shock, intubated. Impression: mesenteric ischemia.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
73-year-old female with melena, prior PUD, and anticoagulation. Impression: upper GI bleed.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
17-year-old female after Ecstasy and alcohol use. One episode vomiting. Exam shows dilated pupils, vitals stable. Impression: Ecstasy ingestion.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
43-year-old male with diffuse bowel necrosis and septic shock secondary to mesenteric venous thrombosis. Impression: bowel ischemia.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
73-year-old with hematochezia and recent GI bleed. Colonoscopy shows diverticulosis and hemorrhoids. Impression: likely hemorrhoidal bleed.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
20-year-old with amphetamine-related MI history presents with chest pain, resolved with Mylanta. Impression: esophageal reflux.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
66-year-old with dizziness, HTN crisis, alcohol withdrawal. BP stabilized with metoprolol. Impression: dizziness due to HTN and alcohol use.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:
81-year-old with melena and near syncope. History of PUD. Hct dropped, received transfusion. Impression: upper GI bleed.

Please respond with the correct ED Short List code.

Casenote:

Forty year‑old male with a history of polysubstance abuse presented to the ED c/o intense pain and swelling of his right lower extremity (RLE) for the past two days. Patient used heroin two consecutive nights prior to presentation and reports falling asleep with his RLE folded underneath his body.

When he woke up in the morning, the leg was swollen and painful to touch. Patient states he could not move his leg due to severe pain. As the day progressed, patient noticed increasing pain and swelling of the leg in addition to the leg turning a blueish color. Patient then presented to the ED.

Upon arrival in the ED, pt was hypotensive, tachycardic, c/o severe pain in RLE.

On PE, the RLE below the knee was severely tender to touch and the soft tissue was very tense.

1. M62.99 — Unspecified disorder of muscle, site unspecified — Myositis; calcification and ossification of muscle; non‑traumatic ischaemic infarction of muscles (compartment syndrome); diseases of muscles caused by infectious and other diseases where the muscle disorder is the principal reason for the attendance; infections due to leprosy and syphilis as the cause of myositis are listed separately as notifiable diseases (NNDSS)
